intro: Hippocratea beccarii, commonly known as the Beccari's hippocratea, is a tropical climbing plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant has a woody stem and can grow quite long, often reaching several meters in length. It is typically found in humid, lowland forests and thrives in warm, moist environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
